Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix(-61)-Robots prerequisite failure?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=QdjKxem9Q3SqR4USDE2pSaTZXACWWiqbqm0x4iNEI2wH
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

It means the necessary robots.txt prerequisite fetch (even getting a 
404) couldn't complete before giving up on the URI in question.

Do you see preceding matching /robots.txt requests in the crawl.log 
showing failure codes?

Other causes could be changing your scope such that /robots.txt URIs 
can't be scheduled, or setting the retries on URIs to a very small 
number. (A URi coming up for consideration, then being rescheduled to 
wait for DNS and then robots prerequisite fetches each counts as a 
retry, so a retry count under 3 prevents this normal consider, 
fetch-prereqs, retry operation.)

- Gordon @ IA
